Section.name: main
Section.String: Are you sure you want to move these {0} items to the Recycle bin?

Section.name: screentip
Section.String: The content of the currently selected folder is reread.\nIf changes are pending, the system asks if the changes should be saved first.
Saves pending changes to disk, by changing the tags of all selected files.
Select the columns, which should be displayed in the Track Details Grid.
Using specific parameters given in the dialog, the various tags like "Track #", "Artist", "Title", etc. are extracted out of the filename.
A hash is built over the first 30 seconds of the file. This hash is then used to identify the file on MusicBrainz.\nThe tags are then retrieved from MusicBrainz and written to the file.
The given Artist and Album Name are used for a lookup at Amazon trying to match the filenames to the list retrieved from Amazon.
A dialog allows editing all the tags of single files.
The tags modified in the dialog are applied on all selected files.
The Artist and Album Name are used to lookup the album cover art on Amazon. If multiple matches are found a selection dialog is displayed.
The album cover art shown is saved as folder.jpg in the folder of the selected file.
The Lyricsengine retrieves the lyrics for the selected files from the Lyrics sources checked in the preferences.
The track number of the selected files is set using the value in the text box as the start number.
While the button is toggled on, a click on a file sets the track number.
All comments found in the selected files are removed.
All cover art information stored in the selected files is removed.
Case Conversion Rules, as set in the Options are applied on all selected files.
All tags are removed from the selected files.
The files are renamed according to the parameters specified in the dialog.
The files are copied/moved to a new location based on their tag values as specified in the dialog parameters.
Applies the script in the combo box to the selected files.
Adds the selected files to the list of files ready for burning on CD.
Adds the selected files to the list of files to be converted to a different format.
Adds the selected files to the Playlist, starting playback with the first file if the player is idle.
Opens the find dialog to search for the specified string in the selected Tracks.
Opens the Find / Replace dialog to replace a specified serach string in the selected Tracks.
Uses MP3Val to validate the correctness of the selected MP3 File. Some errors may be fixed using the "Fix MP3" Button
Uses MP3Val to fix errors detected in the selected MP3 File.
Start Ripping of the selected files
Start Conversion of the files in the list to the selected format
Starts burning of files found in the burn list.

Section.name: TagEdit
Section.String: The rating is 1-255 where 1 is worst and 255 is best. 0 is unknown.\n\nNote: Many programs have their own rating and may redefine the ID3 standard. If no personal counter is wanted it may be omitted.

Section.name: LyricsSearch
Section.String: Search Finished. Unselect tracks with incorrect Lyrics.
There is nothing to search for

Section.name: MusicBrainz
Section.String: The track is available on multiple albums. Please select

Section.name: TagAndRename
Section.String: Parameters (Click to add to the list)
\ = Folder: to specify that parameters in front of it to be taken from the folder name
Filename too long. Please change it.
File already exists. Common Tags used?

Section.name: organise
Section.String: Override Target Root Directory using Script:
Copy Files instead of Moving them
File already exists. Will not be replaced
Source and Target File are the same. File skipped
\ = Folder: to specify that parameters in front to be used as subfoldername within target folder

Section.name: Settings
Section.String: Fast Mode (fast, but some compromise in compression ratio)
Invalid Parameter Format for Ripped Filename. Please Correct.
This preset should provide near transparency to most people on most music. (Bitrate Range 140-185)
This preset should generally be transparent to most people on most music and is already quite high in quality. (Bitrate Range 170-210)
If you have extremely good hearing and similar equipment, this preset will generally provide slightly higher quality than the "standard" mode. (Bitrate Range 220-260)
CBR 320 kbps. This preset will usually be overkill for most people and most situations, but if you must have the absolute highest quality with no regard to filesize, this is the way to go.

For ABR modes (high quality per given bitrate but not as high as VBR). Using this preset will usually give you good quality at a specified bitrate.\n\nDepending on the bitrate entered, this preset will determine the optimal settings for that particular situation. While this approach works, it is not nearly as flexible as VBR, and usually will not attain the same level of quality as VBR at higher bitrates.
Overwrite existing Cover(s) on automatic tagging
Embed existing folder thumb (folder.jpg) on cover search
Save Cover Art only to folder thumb. Don't touch the music file
Overwrite existing lyrics on automatic tagging
Copy Artist to AlbumArtist when empty
Auto Fill "Number of Tracks" on Multiple Tag Edit
Use case conversion settings on Save
Create missing folder thumb (folder.jpg) on Save
Use MediaPortal Music Database for Artist auto completion
Use Version 2.4 for ID3 V2 Tags
Use Version 2.3 for ID3 V2 Tags
Use APE and ID3 V1 Tags
Clear User Defined Frames on Save
Validate Mp3 Files while scanning the folder / database
If no MediaPortal Music Database is available, a database may be created, by entering a file name in the above text box.\nThen start the scan.
The selected database does not exist.\nIf you select "Yes" a new database will be created.\nStart a Scan to fill the database.
Select the Folder with your Music Files
Database Scan is still active.\nAbort the scan and quit the application?
Select the format you wish to encode to:
Warning: Preset settings will not be used, when specifying Lame parameters
Warning: Above settings will not be used, when specifying Ogg Expert parameters
Warning: Above settings will not be used, when specifying FLAC Expert parameters
Warning: Preset settings will not be used, when specifying Musepack parameters
Warning: Preset settings will not be used, when specifying WavPackparameters

Section.name: Burning
Section.String: No Media ifound in drive. Please insert an empty Disc.
Use Drag & Drop to order the tracks for burning
Can't burn on a finished media. Please insert an empty Disc
Warning: Collection exceed Device Capacity! Remove some files.

Section.name: Conversion
Section.String: Conversion aborted: Input and Output file are the same
Finished Ripping the selected Audio Tracks.

Section.name: FreeDB
Section.String: Multiple Matches Found on FreeDB. Please select a valid disc

Section.name: Lookup
Section.String: No album found, please choose another selection criteria.

Section.name: message
Section.String: Changes have not been saved. Do you want to save the changes?
The compile of the script failed.\n\nPlease look for the error in the log and correct it.
Please select at least one row to perform the action
Do you really want to delete the selected files(s)?
To delete a Folder, please use Shift-Del
Fatal Exception. MPTagThat will be terminated\r\nPlease look at log for the reason of termination
Too many files scanned. Running out of Memory.\r\nAborting Scan.

Section.name: about
Section.String: MPTagThat is an open source Tag Editor, which allows managing your complete Music Collection.\n\nMore information at:

Section.name: dbsearch
Section.String: To use the Database search function,\nyou must enter the location of the Music Database in the Settings.
Please enter at least one Value to search for.
Query returned too much rows. Only displaying the first 1000.

Section.name: findreplace
Section.String: No more occurences of search string found

Section.name: readonly
Section.String: The indicated file is read-only.\nShould MPTagThat change the attribute and save the file?
